CHECK_TITLE: Launch configuration with unencrypted block device.
DESCRIPTION: Block devices should be encrypted to ensure sensitive data is held securely at rest.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Turn on encryption for all block devices

CHECK_TITLE: Launch configuration should not have a public IP address.
DESCRIPTION: You should limit the provision of public IP addresses for resources. Resources should not be exposed on the public internet, but should have access limited to consumers required for the function of your application.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set the instance to not be publicly accessible

CHECK_TITLE: Config configuration aggregator should be using all regions for source
DESCRIPTION:
Sources that aren't covered by the aggregator are not include in the configuration. The configuration aggregator should be configured with all_regions for the source.
This will help limit the risk of any unmonitored configuration in regions that are thought to be unused.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set the aggregator to cover all regions

CHECK_TITLE: EBS volumes must be encrypted
DESCRIPTION: By enabling encryption on EBS volumes you protect the volume, the disk I/O and any derived snapshots from compromise if intercepted.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable encryption of EBS volumes

CHECK_TITLE: EBS volume encryption should use Customer Managed Keys
DESCRIPTION: Encryption using AWS keys provides protection for your EBS volume. To increase control of the encryption and manage factors like rotation use customer managed keys.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable encryption using customer managed keys

CHECK_TITLE: aws_instance should activate session tokens for Instance Metadata Service.
DESCRIPTION: IMDS v2 (Instance Metadata Service) introduced session authentication tokens which improve security when talking to IMDS. By default aws_instance resource sets IMDS session auth tokens to be optional. To fully protect IMDS you need to enable session tokens by using metadata_options block and its http_tokens variable set to required.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable HTTP token requirement for IMDS

CHECK_TITLE: User data for EC2 instances must not contain sensitive AWS keys
DESCRIPTION: EC2 instance data is used to pass start up information into the EC2 instance. This userdata must not contain access key credentials. Instead use an IAM Instance Profile assigned to the instance to grant access to other AWS Services.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Remove sensitive data from the EC2 instance user-data

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Password policy should prevent password reuse.
DESCRIPTION:
IAM account password policies should prevent the reuse of passwords.

The account password policy should be set to prevent using any of the last five used passwords.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Prevent password reuse in the policy

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Password policy should have requirement for at least one lowercase character.
DESCRIPTION: IAM account password policies should ensure that passwords content including at least one lowercase character.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enforce longer, more complex passwords in the policy

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Password policy should have requirement for at least one number in the password.
DESCRIPTION: IAM account password policies should ensure that passwords content including at least one number.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enforce longer, more complex passwords in the policy

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Password policy should have requirement for at least one symbol in the password.
DESCRIPTION: IAM account password policies should ensure that passwords content including a symbol.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enforce longer, more complex passwords in the policy

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Password policy should have requirement for at least one uppercase character.
DESCRIPTION:
,

IAM account password policies should ensure that passwords content including at least one uppercase character.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enforce longer, more complex passwords in the policy

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Password policy should have expiry less than or equal to 90 days.
DESCRIPTION:
IAM account password policies should have a maximum age specified.

The account password policy should be set to expire passwords after 90 days or less.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Limit the password duration with an expiry in the policy

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Password policy should have minimum password length of 14 or more characters.
DESCRIPTION:
IAM account password policies should ensure that passwords have a minimum length.

The account password policy should be set to enforce minimum password length of at least 14 characters.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enforce longer, more complex passwords in the policy

CHECK_TITLE: S3 Access block should block public ACL
DESCRIPTION: S3 buckets should block public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By blocking, PUTs with fail if the object has any public ACL a.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable blocking any PUT calls with a public ACL specified

CHECK_TITLE: S3 Access block should block public policy
DESCRIPTION: S3 bucket policy should have block public policy to prevent users from putting a policy that enable public access.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Prevent policies that allow public access being PUT

CHECK_TITLE: S3 Data should be versioned
DESCRIPTION:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket.

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.

When you enable versioning, also keep in mind the potential costs of storing noncurrent versions of objects. To help manage those costs, consider setting up an S3 Lifecycle configuration.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

CHECK_TITLE: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public ACL
DESCRIPTION: S3 buckets should ignore public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By ignoring rather than blocking, PUT calls with public ACLs will still be applied but the ACL will be ignored.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable ignoring the application of public ACLs in PUT calls

CHECK_TITLE: S3 Buckets not publicly accessible through ACL.
DESCRIPTION: Buckets should not have ACLs that allow public access
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Don't use canned ACLs or switch to private acl

CHECK_TITLE: S3 Access block should restrict public bucket to limit access
DESCRIPTION: S3 buckets should restrict public policies for the bucket. By enabling, the restrict_public_buckets, only the bucket owner and AWS Services can access if it has a public policy.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Limit the access to public buckets to only the owner or AWS Services (eg; CloudFront)

CHECK_TITLE: S3 buckets should each define an aws_s3_bucket_public_access_block
DESCRIPTION: The "block public access" settings in S3 override individual policies that apply to a given bucket, meaning that all public access can be controlled in one central types for that bucket. It is therefore good practice to define these settings for each bucket in order to clearly define the public access that can be allowed for it.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Define a aws_s3_bucket_public_access_block for the given bucket to control public access policies

CHECK_TITLE: Missing description for security group.
DESCRIPTION:
Security groups should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Add descriptions for all security groups

CHECK_TITLE: AWS best practice to not use the default VPC for workflows
DESCRIPTION: Default VPC does not have a lot of the critical security features that standard VPC comes with, new resources should not be created in the default VPC and it should not be present in the Terraform.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Create a non-default vpc for resources to be created in

CHECK_TITLE: An Network ACL rule allows ALL ports.
DESCRIPTION: Ensure access to specific required ports is allowed, and nothing else.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set specific allowed ports

CHECK_TITLE: Network ACLs should not allow unrestricted ingress to SSH or RDP from any IP address.
DESCRIPTION:
The Network Access Control List (NACL) function provide stateless filtering of ingress and
egress network traffic to AWS resources. It is recommended that no NACL allows
unrestricted ingress access to remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22
and RDP to port 3389.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set a more restrictive CIDR range

CHECK_TITLE: Security groups should not allow unrestricted ingress to SSH or RDP from any IP address.
DESCRIPTION:
Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress and egress network traffic to AWS
resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to
remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22 and RDP to port 3389.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set a more restrictive CIDR range

CHECK_TITLE: Ensure all data stored in the launch configuration EBS is securely encrypted
DESCRIPTION: When creating Launch Configurations, user data can be used for the initial configuration of the instance. User data must not contain any sensitive data.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Don't use sensitive data in user data

CHECK_TITLE: IAM groups should have MFA enforcement activated.
DESCRIPTION: IAM groups should be protected with multi factor authentication to add safe guards to password compromise.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Use terraform-module/enforce-mfa/aws to ensure that MFA is enforced

CHECK_TITLE: User data for EC2 instances must not contain sensitive AWS keys
DESCRIPTION: EC2 instance data is used to pass start up information into the EC2 instance. This userdata must not contain access key credentials. Instead use an IAM Instance Profile assigned to the instance to grant access to other AWS Services.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Remove sensitive data from the EC2 instance user-data generated by launch templates

CHECK_TITLE: aws_instance should activate session tokens for Instance Metadata Service.
DESCRIPTION: IMDS v2 (Instance Metadata Service) introduced session authentication tokens which improve security when talking to IMDS. By default aws_instance resource sets IMDS session auth tokens to be optional. To fully protect IMDS you need to enable session tokens by using metadata_options block and its http_tokens variable set to required.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable HTTP token requirement for IMDS

CHECK_TITLE: Instance with unencrypted block device.
DESCRIPTION: Block devices should be encrypted to ensure sensitive data is held securely at rest.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Turn on encryption for all block devices

CHECK_TITLE: The "root" account has unrestricted access to all resources in the AWS account. It is highly recommended that the use of this account be avoided.
DESCRIPTION: The root user has unrestricted access to all services and resources in an AWS account. We highly recommend that you avoid using the root user for daily tasks. Minimizing the use of the root user and adopting the principle of least privilege for access management reduce the risk of accidental changes and unintended disclosure of highly privileged credentials.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Use lower privileged accounts instead, so only required privileges are available.

CHECK_TITLE: The root user has complete access to all services and resources in an AWS account. AWS Access Keys provide programmatic access to a given account.
DESCRIPTION: CIS recommends that all access keys be associated with the root user be removed. Removing access keys associated with the root user limits vectors that the account can be compromised by. Removing the root user access keys also encourages the creation and use of role-based accounts that are least privileged.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Use lower privileged accounts instead, so only required privileges are available.

CHECK_TITLE: IAM policies should not be granted directly to users.
DESCRIPTION: CIS recommends that you apply IAM policies directly to groups and roles but not users. Assigning privileges at the group or role level reduces the complexity of access management as the number of users grow. Reducing access management complexity might in turn reduce opportunity for a principal to inadvertently receive or retain excessive privileges.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Grant policies at the group level instead.

CHECK_TITLE: Instances in a subnet should not receive a public IP address by default.
DESCRIPTION: You should limit the provision of public IP addresses for resources. Resources should not be exposed on the public internet, but should have access limited to consumers required for the function of your application.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set the instance to not be publicly accessible

CHECK_TITLE: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. After you've created a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet "Rejects" for VPCs.
DESCRIPTION: VPC Flow Logs provide visibility into network traffic that traverses the VPC and can be used to detect anomalous traffic or insight during security workflows.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable flow logs for VPC

CHECK_TITLE: S3 DNS Compliant Bucket Names
DESCRIPTION: Ensures that S3 buckets have DNS complaint bucket names.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Recreate S3 bucket to use - instead of . in S3 bucket names

CHECK_TITLE: IAM Pass Role Filtering
DESCRIPTION: Ensures any IAM pass role attached to roles are flagged and warned.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Resolve permission escalations by denying pass role'

CHECK_TITLE: AWS AMI data source should specify owners
DESCRIPTION:
AWS AMI data source should specify owners to avoid using unverified AMIs.
The owners field helps ensure you're using AMIs from known and trusted sources.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Specify the owners field in the AWS AMI data source configuration

CHECK_TITLE: Disallow unrestricted S3 IAM Policies
DESCRIPTION: Ensure that the creation of the unrestricted S3 IAM policies is disallowed.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Create more restrictive S3 policies

CHECK_TITLE: Reduce unnecessary unauthorized access or information disclosure of S3 buckets.
DESCRIPTION: Unnecessary access to S3 buckets can lead to unauthorized access or information disclosure.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Allowing Get* along with Put* on all Resources can potentially allow unauthorized access and/or information disclosure from sensitive buckets.

CHECK_TITLE: Storage containers in blob storage mode should not have public access
DESCRIPTION:
Storage container public access should be off. It can be configured for blobs only, containers and blobs or off entirely. The default is off, with no public access.
Explicitly overriding publicAccess to anything other than off should be avoided.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Disable public access to storage containers

CHECK_TITLE: Storage accounts should be configured to only accept transfers that are over secure connections
DESCRIPTION:
You can configure your storage account to accept requests from secure connections only by setting the Secure transfer required property for the storage account.
When you require secure transfer, any requests originating from an insecure connection are rejected.
Microsoft recommends that you always require secure transfer for all of your storage accounts.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Only allow secure connection for transferring data into storage accounts

CHECK_TITLE: When using Queue Services for a storage account, logging should be enabled.
DESCRIPTION:
Storage Analytics logs detailed information about successful and failed requests to a storage service.
This information can be used to monitor individual requests and to diagnose issues with a storage service.
Requests are logged on a best-effort basis.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable logging for Queue Services

CHECK_TITLE: Trusted Microsoft Services should have bypass access to Storage accounts
DESCRIPTION:
Some Microsoft services that interact with storage accounts operate from networks that can't be granted access through network rules.
To help this type of service work as intended, allow the set of trusted Microsoft services to bypass the network rules
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Allow Trusted Microsoft Services to bypass

CHECK_TITLE: The minimum TLS version for Storage Accounts should be TLS1_2 or higher
DESCRIPTION:
Azure Storage supports four versions of the TLS protocol: 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3.
Azure Storage uses TLS 1.2 or TLS 1.3 on public HTTPS endpoints, while TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 are still supported for backward compatibility.
This check will warn if the minimum TLS version is set lower than TLS1_2. TLS1_2 and TLS1_3 are both allowed.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Use a more recent TLS version for the storage account

CHECK_TITLE: The default action on Storage account network rules should be set to deny
DESCRIPTION:
The default_action for network rules should come into effect when no other rules are matched.
The default action should be set to Deny.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set network rules to deny

CHECK_TITLE: Storage account should have blob soft delete enabled
DESCRIPTION:
Blob soft delete protects blob data from being accidentally or erroneously modified or deleted.
When blob soft delete is enabled, deleted blobs are retained in the system for a specified retention period.
During the retention period, you can restore a soft-deleted blob to its state at the time it was deleted.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable soft delete for blobs with an appropriate retention period

CHECK_TITLE: Storage account should have logging enabled
DESCRIPTION:
Storage Analytics logs detailed information about successful and failed requests to a storage service.
This information can be used to monitor individual requests and to diagnose issues with a storage service.
Logging should be enabled for at least one storage service type.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable logging for at least one storage service (Queue, Table, or Blob)

CHECK_TITLE: Storage account should use geo-redundant replication
DESCRIPTION:
Geo-redundant storage (GRS) replicates your data to a secondary region that is hundreds of miles away from the primary region.
This provides an additional level of durability for your data in the event of a complete regional outage or a disaster.
Options include GRS, RAGRS, GZRS, and RAGZRS for geo-redundancy.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Configure storage account to use geo-redundant replication (GRS, RAGRS, GZRS, or RAGZRS)

CHECK_TITLE: Storage account should have secure transfer and minimum TLS version configured
DESCRIPTION:
Storage accounts should enforce HTTPS for secure data transfer and use a minimum TLS version of 1.2.
This ensures that logs and data stored in the storage account are encrypted in transit.
Azure Storage encrypts all data at rest by default, but transport encryption is also critical.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable secure transfer and set minimum TLS version to TLS1_2

CHECK_TITLE: Storage account should use customer-managed keys for encryption
DESCRIPTION:
Storage accounts should use customer-managed keys (CMK) for encryption to provide additional control over the encryption keys.
Customer-managed keys allow you to create, rotate, disable, and revoke access controls.
They also provide greater flexibility to audit the encryption keys that are used to protect your data.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Configure customer-managed keys for storage account encryption

CHECK_TITLE: Storage account should have infrastructure encryption enabled
DESCRIPTION:
Infrastructure encryption provides an additional layer of encryption at the infrastructure level.
When infrastructure encryption is enabled, data in the storage account is encrypted twice -
once at the service level and once at the infrastructure level with two different encryption algorithms.
This provides double encryption for enhanced security.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable infrastructure encryption for storage account

CHECK_TITLE: A firewall rule should not allow unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
DESCRIPTION: Opening up ports to allow connections from the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that are explicitly required where possible.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set a more restrictive cidr range

CHECK_TITLE: VPC flow logs should be enabled for all subnetworks
DESCRIPTION: VPC flow logs record information about all traffic, which is a vital tool in reviewing anomalous traffic.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable VPC flow logs

CHECK_TITLE: Disable project-wide SSH keys for all instances
DESCRIPTION: Use of project-wide SSH keys means that a compromise of any one of these key pairs can result in all instances being compromised. It is recommended to use instance-level keys.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Disable project-wide SSH keys

CHECK_TITLE: Instances should not have public IP addresses
DESCRIPTION: Instances should not be publicly exposed to the internet
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Remove public IP

CHECK_TITLE: Disable serial port connectivity for all instances
DESCRIPTION: When serial port access is enabled, the access is not governed by network security rules meaning the port can be exposed publicly.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Disable serial port access

CHECK_TITLE: VM disks should be encrypted with Customer Supplied Encryption Keys
DESCRIPTION: Using unmanaged keys makes rotation and general management difficult.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Use managed keys

CHECK_TITLE: Disks should be encrypted with customer managed encryption keys
DESCRIPTION: Using unmanaged keys makes rotation and general management difficult.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Use managed keys to encrypt disks.

CHECK_TITLE: A firewall rule should not allow unrestricted egress to any IP address.
DESCRIPTION: Opening up ports to connect out to the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that are explicitly required where possible.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set a more restrictive cidr range

CHECK_TITLE: Instances should not override the project setting for OS Login
DESCRIPTION: OS Login automatically revokes the relevant SSH keys when an IAM user has their access revoked.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable OS Login at project level and remove instance-level overrides

CHECK_TITLE: The encryption key used to encrypt a compute disk has been specified in plaintext.
DESCRIPTION: Sensitive values such as raw encryption keys should not be included in your Terraform code, and should be stored securely by a secrets manager.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Reference a managed key rather than include the key in raw format.

CHECK_TITLE: SSL policies should enforce secure versions of TLS
DESCRIPTION: TLS versions prior to 1.2 are outdated and insecure. You should use 1.2 as aminimum version.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enforce a minimum TLS version of 1.2

CHECK_TITLE: Instances should have Shielded VM VTPM enabled
DESCRIPTION: The virtual TPM provides numerous security measures to your VM.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable Shielded VM VTPM

CHECK_TITLE: OS Login should be enabled at project level
DESCRIPTION: OS Login automatically revokes the relevant SSH keys when an IAM user has their access revoked.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable OS Login at project level

CHECK_TITLE: Instances should not have IP forwarding enabled
DESCRIPTION: Disabling IP forwarding ensures the instance can only receive packets addressed to the instance and can only send packets with a source address of the instance.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Disable IP forwarding

CHECK_TITLE: Instances should not use the default service account
DESCRIPTION: The default service account has full project access. Instances should instead be assigned the minimal access they need.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Remove use of default service account

CHECK_TITLE: Instances should have Shielded VM integrity monitoring enabled
DESCRIPTION: Integrity monitoring helps you understand and make decisions about the state of your VM instances.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable Shielded VM Integrity Monitoring

CHECK_TITLE: Instances should have Shielded VM secure boot enabled
DESCRIPTION: Secure boot helps ensure that the system only runs authentic software.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable Shielded VM secure boot

CHECK_TITLE: RDP Access Is Not Restricted
DESCRIPTION: Firewall rules should restrict RDP (TCP/3389) access to specific IP ranges. Open RDP access can be a security risk.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Restrict RDP (TCP port 3389) ingress in firewall rules. Only allow trusted IP ranges or use Identity-Aware Proxy for RDP access.

CHECK_TITLE: SSH Access Is Not Restricted
DESCRIPTION: Firewall rules should restrict SSH (TCP/22) access to specific IPs. Open SSH can be a security risk.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Restrict SSH (TCP port 22) access in firewall rules to known IP addresses or ranges. Avoid open 0.0.0.0/0 access for SSH.

CHECK_TITLE: Google Compute Network Using Firewall Rule that Allows All Ports
DESCRIPTION: Firewall rules should not be wide open to all ports. Lock down rules to only required ports.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Modify firewall rules that allow all ports to restrict to only required ports. Use separate rules for specific port ranges as needed, instead of a single overly broad rule.

CHECK_TITLE: Disable Default Firewall Rules
DESCRIPTION:
Ensures that Google Cloud's default firewall rules are disabled, as they may be overly permissive and pose security risks.
The default network comes with pre-populated firewall rules that allow broad access and should be replaced with more restrictive custom rules.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Replace default firewall rules with custom, more restrictive rules appropriate for your security requirements

CHECK_TITLE: Google Compute Network Using Firewall Rule that Allows Large Port Range
DESCRIPTION: Firewall rules allowing broad port ranges can be risky. Ensure rules are as specific as possible.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Limit firewall rules to necessary port ranges only. If a wide range is specified, consider splitting into smaller ranges or specific ports needed for your application.

CHECK_TITLE: Google Compute Subnetwork with Private Google Access Disabled
DESCRIPTION: Private Google Access allows instances in a subnet to reach Google APIs and services via internal IP, which should be enabled for private networks.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable Private Google Access on subnets. In Terraform, set `private_ip_google_access = true` in the `google_compute_subnetwork` resource.

CHECK_TITLE: Google Compute Subnetwork Logging Disabled
DESCRIPTION: Flow logs for subnets should be enabled to capture network traffic details for security analysis.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Enable VPC Flow Logs for subnets. In Terraform, set `enable_flow_logs = true` in the `google_compute_subnetwork` resource.

CHECK_TITLE: S3 Bucket Logging
DESCRIPTION: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Add a logging block to the resource to enable access logging

CHECK_TITLE: A security group rule should not allow unrestricted egress to any IP address.
STATUS_EXTENDED: Security group rule allows unrestricted egress to any IP address.
DESCRIPTION: Opening up ports to connect out to the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that are explicitly required where possible.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set a more restrictive cidr range

CHECK_TITLE: A security group rule should not allow unrestricted egress to any IP address.
STATUS_EXTENDED: Security group rule allows unrestricted egress to any IP address.
DESCRIPTION: Opening up ports to connect out to the public internet is generally to be avoided. You should restrict access to IP addresses or ranges that are explicitly required where possible.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Set a more restrictive cidr range

CHECK_TITLE: Missing description for security group rule.
STATUS_EXTENDED: Security group rule does not have a description.
DESCRIPTION:
Security group rules should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

CHECK_TITLE: S3 encryption should use Customer Managed Keys
STATUS_EXTENDED: Bucket does not encrypt data with a customer managed key.
DESCRIPTION:
Encryption using AWS keys provides protection for your S3 buckets. To gain greater control over encryption, such as key rotation, access policies, and auditability, use customer managed keys (CMKs) with SSE-KMS.
Note that SSE-KMS is not supported for S3 server access logging destination buckets; in such cases, use SSE-S3 instead.
RISK: This provider has not defined a risk for this check.
REMEDIATION_RECOMMENDATION_TEXT: Use SSE-KMS with a customer managed key (CMK)
